content.description:
What one issue mattered most to you in deciding how you voted for president? Open-ended1 Closed-ended2 The economy 35%     58%     The war in Iraq 5     10     Health care 4     8     Terrorism 6     8     Energy policy 0     6     Other 43     8     Total100     100     
1 unprompted first response to open-ended question
2 first choice from five options read to respondents
Source: Pew Research, November 2008 post-election survey.
content.question: Which of the following best explains how the format affected the polls?

choices.label: The closed-ended format limited respondents to fewer options, which forced respondents to focus on the most important issue of those options.
The closed-ended format decreased participation because it was more difficult for respondents to think of a response.
The open-ended format increased the number of respondents who mentioned energy policy because the poll reminded them of the issue.
The open-ended format limited the number of potential responses, which affected the accuracy of the poll.

content.answer: The closed-ended format limited respondents to fewer options, which forced respondents to focus on the most important issue of those options.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Explain patterns and trends in data to draw conclusions.
